A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Visually stunning. 
That said\, writing/script was a total mess. 
SPOILERS
Lessons viewers learned from the movie? Don't read important books containing wisdom if they're boring\, because "failure is the best teacher"; the rebels will win because they'll save each other\, said by one of the characters responsible for killing hundreds while trying to save them.
The sole black main character again starts a coward and is no longer a romantic interest of the heroine; instead she's attracted to the bad guy she's hoping she can change or the rebellious white guy hero.
I liked having the movie give another look at morality besides light and dark... except\, after briefly touching on it\, it again falls back to light and dark morality.
Did you hate how the new Star Trek movies introduced technology that destroyed their franchise? (Transporters eliminating the need for starships or being able to cure death?!?); Well\, apparently JJ Abrams must have had his meaty hand on this too. Be prepared for a new rebel weapon that can take out whole imperial fleets at the cost of a Droid and hyperdrive equipped fighter.

When Fanboys tell you that all the Star Wars movies ignored science and physics... Should we just ignore it? Or do we demand better science in science fiction?

Rogue One has been the only redeeming Star Wars movie in recent times. This movie finally convinced me to no longer see these movies in theaters. I'll watch em at home when I can stream em
